intro: Malacolepis, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, particularly in the fynbos biome. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. Malacolepis species are adapted to nutrient-poor soils and are often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. They play an important role in their ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
